009package Ch02_Histograms_Statistics;
010
011import java.awt.Rectangle;
012
013import ij.IJ;
014import ij.ImagePlus;
015import ij.WindowManager;
016import ij.gui.Roi;
017import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
018import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
019import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
021import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
022import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
023
024import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
025
026/**
027 * <p>
028 * This ImageJ plugin first calculates the integral image for the current image (8 bit grayscale only) and uses it to
029 * find the mean and variance inside the specified rectangle (ROI). Requires a rectangular ROI to be selected. Note that
030 * these values are directly obtained from the integral images and do not require any iterations over image pixels or
031 * other arrays. Thus such calculations are extremely quick. See Sec. 2.8 of [1] for additional details.
032 * </p>
033 * <p>
034 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
035 * (2022).
036 * </p>
037 *
038 * @author WB
039 * @see IntegralImage
040 */
041public class Integral_Image_GetRoiStatistics implements PlugInFilter {
042        
043        private ImagePlus im = null;
044
045        /** Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open. */
046        public Integral_Image_GetRoiStatistics() {
047                if (noCurrentImage()) {
048                        if (DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.IrishManor)) {
049                                ImagePlus cim = WindowManager.getCurrentImage();
050                                // set up some ROI
051                                cim.setRoi(new Rectangle(85, 65, 200, 150));
052                        }
053                }
054        }
055
056        @Override
057        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus im) {
058                this.im = im;
059                return DOES_8G + ROI_REQUIRED + NO_CHANGES;
060        }
061
062        @Override
063        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
064                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
065                if (roi.getType() != Roi.RECTANGLE) {
066                        IJ.error("Rectangular selection required!");
067                        return;
068                }
069                
070                Rectangle rect = roi.getBounds();       
071                int u0 = rect.x;
072                int v0 = rect.y;
073                int u1 = u0 + rect.width - 1;
074                int v1 = v0 + rect.height - 1;
075                
076                IntegralImage iI = new IntegralImage((ByteProcessor) ip);
077                double mean = iI.getMean(u0, v0, u1, v1);
078                double var = iI.getVariance(u0, v0, u1, v1);
079                
080                IJ.log("ROI rectangle = " + rect);
081                IJ.log("ROI area = " + rect.width * rect.height);
082                IJ.log("ROI mean = " + String.format("%.3f", mean));
083                IJ.log("ROI variance = " + String.format("%.3f", var));
084                IJ.log("ROI stddev = " + String.format("%.3f", Math.sqrt(var)));
085
086        }
087}
